{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3567102,"name":"","username":"thegravitor","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thegravitor/{size}/237066_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-24T17:41:53.332Z","cooked":"

My team is looking to make a side to side slow movement for our swerve so when at the reef we could bump button a and then move a little bit left or right any advice or examples to help us get started would be amazing we are using all ctre swerve if this info helps

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-03-24T17:41:53.332Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":126,"readers_count":125,"score":55.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":496741,"topic_slug":"side-to-side-movement-swerve","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57952,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/side-to-side-movement-swerve/496741/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3567110,"name":"Joey Tidrow","username":"Arrowmag","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/arrowmag/{size}/233870_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-24T17:51:29.638Z","cooked":"

This is what we use. You can just remap the left bumper trigger to the a button. If you share a link to your code I can probably tell you what you need to add to yours.

github.com

PrecisionGuessworks/2025-Comp-Robot/blob/main/src/main/java/frc/robot/RobotContainer.java#L280-L284


      
    
          
  1. driver.leftTrigger().or(() -> (RobotContainer.elevator.getHeight() >= Constants.Elevator.SlowmodeHeight) && !DriverStation.isAutonomous()).whileTrue(drivetrain.applyRequest(() ->
    2. 
          
  2. drive.withVelocityX(-driver.getLeftY() * MaxSpeed * Constants.Drive.SlowSpeedPercentage) // Drive forward with negative Y (forward)
    3. 
          
  3.     .withVelocityY(-driver.getLeftX() * MaxSpeed * Constants.Drive.SlowSpeedPercentage) // Drive left with negative X (left)
    4. 
          
  4.     .withRotationalRate(-driver.getRightX() * MaxAngularRate * Constants.Drive.SlowRotPercentage) // Drive counterclockwise with negative X (left)
    5. 
          
  5. ));
    6.

Just had to upload the fresh code so here that also is that just set up for half speed or could we change that to like .2 or something along those lines

This code should work if you paste it in line 66 within RobotContainer.java. I kept it so you have to hold the left trigger to go into slow mode because the a button was already being used and pressing the a button would make the driver take their thumbs off of the joysticks while driving which you want to try to limit.

joystick.leftTrigger().whileTrue(drivetrain.applyRequest(() ->
        drive.withVelocityX(-driver.getLeftY() * MaxSpeed * 0.2) 
            .withVelocityY(-driver.getLeftX() * MaxSpeed * 0.2) 
            .withRotationalRate(-driver.getRightX() * MaxAngularRate * 0.2) 
        ));

This is a good suggestion, but in addition I would check to see if the driver wants this “at the reef side to side movement” to be robot relative rather than field relative. Ours did. The “drive” being used by this code in an instance of the CTRE class “FieldCentric”. There is also a CTRE class “RobotCentric” that you could use for just these at the reef slow movements.
